item.title: Weather
item.description: “Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.” Anthony J. D’Angelo. Cards It’s great here. Have had unbroken sunshine ever since we arrived. We’re having a wonderful time-though in the middle of the day it’s just too scorching hot to do anything but lie on the beach soaking up the sunshine. This is the life! It’s been pouring with rain all day. In fact I’ve never seen such torrential rain!

item.title: 8 Everyday verbs 2
item.description: Get is a very common verb in English, but it is not always appropriate for talking about changes. Note also alternatives to get which can improve your style. A Go, not get Go is used for changes in people’s personality, appearance and physical abilities: People go mad/bald/grey/blind/deaf.
